values.description: We are a community led organisation in Brighton providing information and advice about learning and work, and a range of support activities for adults. For those who are looking to go back to work we offer careers advice, employment support and a range of tailored resources.

values.description:
Onpromotions is a Brighton-based company producing bespoke solus and composite advertorials for national publications including:

*The Sunday Telegraph
*The Independent
*Country & Townhouse magazine

We see the process through from concept to sale, then production to publication - providing copywriting, photography, and design.
values.name: Onpromotions

values.description:
The GuestHouse Storytellers is a non-profit performance storytelling club for adults run by volunteers that meets on the second Tuesday of each month at The Hillcrest Centre in Newhaven, East Sussex. We tell a range from traditional tales, myths and fairytales from around the world to modern and autobiographical stories. Our intention is to provide entertainment and engage the local community in sharing and exchanging stories that are meaningful to them.

We invite professional storytellers three times a year and have hosted Hugh Lupton, Rachel Rose Reid, Michael and Wendy Dacre, Duncan MacIntosh, Jamie Crawford, Ben Fairlight, Raphael Rodan and, in April 2011, Sally Pomme Clayton. We also invite exchanges with tellers from other storytelling clubs within easy travelling distance: so far we have enjoyed exchanges with Brighton Storytellers and Three Heads in a Well in Ewell, Surrey.

We also put on or sponsor performance or autobiographical storytelling courses from time to time. See our website for further details.
values.name: The GuestHouse Storytellers

values.description:
Event and PR photographer covering London providing event photographer throughout London. Conference  & PR photography for an awards ceremonies and corporate Business events.

Materialise Interiors Limited
values.description:
Materialise Interiors is a Brighton-based interior design company run by Chloe Bullock, working for clients countrywide. We have undertaken a broad range of projects; from a single fixture design, to 3D CAD models, to rebranding, to entire fit out including branding and shopfront if required. Projects are mainly corporate and commercial properties but residential interior projects can also be undertaken.

We work with a reliable network of suppliers, contractors, manufacturers and marketing professionals. Larger projects can be worked on in partnership with Goldcrest Contractors, enabling us to offer a complete planning, design and build service to our clients.

The extent of our involvement can span from a complete design and build project, to individual parts of a project:

fixture design (to date – retail fixtures and reception desks)
3D CAD models
CAD furniture layouts
CAD drawing pack for trades
implementation of rebranding to interiors and shopfront
preparation of shopfront and signage planning applications
licensing drawings
entire interior fit out including branding and shopfront design and build where required.
Projects are mainly corporate and commercial properties but residential interior projects have also been undertaken.
We have recently worked on:

schools
dental practices (conversions from former offices, residential and retail unit to practices)
restaurants
golf club
spa
offices
department store café concept
high street retail interiors
high street retail fixture concepts
clinic
pubs

Touch Fantastic
values.description:
Touch Fantastic Ltd is a boutique iOS development studio, supporting entrepreneurs, creative and web agencies in Brighton and London.

Founded by James Carroll in 2008, the Touch Fantastic team are experts in creating apps for iPhone and iPad and bridge the gap between expensive mobile agencies and unreliable freelancers.

Their first app, Dishy, launched in 2009 to critical praise and #1 chart success. Their app for BBC Dragons' Den star Levi Roots reached #1 in the UK lifestyle chart, headed Apple's list of the hottest cooking apps of the year and was featured in the Sunday Times' list of the world's best 500 apps (along with Dishy).

Based in Brighton, Fruitmedia consists of a highly creative team with experience in all areas of video production. We strive to create the best possible working relationships with our clients and are dedicated to producing fresh, creative media solutions that are both original and effective.
values.name: Fruitmedia Ltd

values.description:
The G6 Group is a Brighton based Model and Talent Management Agency. We specialise in going further than standard management companies by adding value to all industries through the gift of beauty.

At G6 our aim to provide a professional service for both the talent and the client. We also host and promote a variety of events so we are quickly becoming one of the number one choices for break through music talent.

Due to our extensive database of talent more and more companies are choosing G6 to help with recruitment services as beauty and commercial skills are a combination guaranteed to produce results. We work across multiple industries including Retail, Media, Events, Beauty and Fitness.

If you are looking to break into the world of Fashion or want to gain exposure for your music then G6 is the natural choice.
values.name: G6 Models

values.description:
Piglet's has had renowned success, securing contracts with Brighton & Hove Albion Football Club, Kensington Palace, Hampton Court and the Royal Attractions, Sussex County Cricket Club, to name a few.  

Our pies have won 4 Gold Awards at The British Pie Awards 2012, Silver at the Football Hospitality Awards 2012 and Highly Commended at the Business Awards. We won Cake vs. Pies and received accolades from Paul Holywood, Chris Evans and Mary Berry  in 2011.

We are the proud winners of Bronze Silver and Gold Awards in the British Pie awards 2013 - and Gold at the Football Hospitality awards 2013. 

Our partnership approach is successful - we work with our clients to develop products that fit their brand and their customers likes and needs.

values.description:

values.description: Magnetic Works are a new, young web design and marketing agency in the heart of sunny Brighton. Working across a variety of sectors, we provide the tools that companies need to succeed in business online. From design concept to analysis of marketing campaigns, we offer a fully bespoke service, tailored to your market and customer base.
values.name: Magnetic Works Limited

values.description:
I'm Sallie-ann, a freelance web developer based in North Devon with over 13 years experience. I have a passion for developing creative, inspiring websites that are accessible, standards compliant and optimised for search engines.

My professional career as a web developer started when I completed a BSc degree in Computing at the University of Brighton.  Prior to working freelance I was the senior web developer for Leicester College, managing their internal and external multimedia and a web developer at Christon Davies – a creative design agency based in Leicester.  I now develop websites and web-based applications both for my own company Hype Digital Media and also for design agencies that outsource their projects to me.

I see myself as a Web Developer and general IT problem solver with the following skills;  PHP, MySQL, XHTML, CSS, jQuery, Content Management, eCommerce, Open Source Software, Object Oriented Programming, Javascript, Accessibility, Flash and Actionscript, Search Engine Optimisation and online marketing.
values.name: Hype Digital Media

values.description: The consultancy specialises in creating integrated long term strategies and providing project management services for clients across the cultural/ creative industries. Four key contracts that the consultancy has managed recently are developing the market for contemporary craft in the North East, a feasibility study (for Nottingham Trent University) for a new fashion and textile centre in Nottingham, delivering the arts strategy for the Royal Parks in London and, with Susie O’Reilly, the delivery of museumaker. Brigid is a lecturer in the Fashion and Textiles department at the Royal College of Art and also an external examiner in business practice in the School of Architecture and Design at Brighton University.
values.name: Brigid Howarth Consultancy Ltd

values.description:
Allergy Therapeutics is een jonge, moderne en innovatieve onderneming met een zeer duidelijke focus: het bedenken, ontwikkelen en produceren van producten voor de diagnostiek en behandeling van allergieën. Sinds 1998 actief onder de nieuwe naam: Allergy Therapeutics, maar als Bencard met een lange historie als onderdeel van SmithKline&Beecham (nu GSK). Het hoofdkantoor van de beursgenoteerde onderneming staat in Worthing, West Sussex, vlak bij Brighton aan de Engelse zuidkust. Allergy Therapeutics is in een hoog tempo zelfstandige vestigingen aan het opzetten in heel Europa en ver daarbuiten.
 
Een nieuwe situatie in Nederland
Na een lange periode van onduidelijkheid over de vergoeding van allergievaccins (subcutaan en sublinguaal) heeft de Inspectie Gezondheidszorg (IGZ) definitief bepaald dat voor de behandeling van allergiepatienten met immunotherapie, een geregisteerd geneesmiddel de voorkeur heeft. Dit besluit komt erop neer dat alle niet-geregistreerde producten op termijn niet meer voor vergoeding in aanmerking komen. Pollinex® heeft aangetoond bewezen effectief en veilig te zijn en is geregistreerd voor de toepassing bij allergieën en wordt volledig vergoed door alle zorgverzekeraars.
values.name: Allergy Therapeutics Nederland B.V

values.name: H.H. Barnum Company
values.description:
H.H. Barnum Company takes great pride in its history, and a continued legacy of placing customers and employees as a priority for over 60 years. In 1946, Herb Barnum founded the company with operations focused on process control valves and instrumentation. After ten years, former World War II bomber pilot and University of Illinois alumnus Ken Koza joined Barnum as a salesman, bringing with him a relentless work ethic and experience as an engineer at industrial control and thermostat manufacturer, Honeywell.

After quickly earning his place as a top salesman, Koza purchased 40 percent of Barnum, eventually taking on full ownership of the company following Mr. Barnum’s retirement in 1975. Koza, soon joined by his sons, Ed and Ken Junior, refocused business efforts from control valves and instrumentation to the distribution of factory automation systems across multiple industries.

At the time of Ken Koza’s retirement in 1988, Barnum stood poised for growth with 12 employees and an opportunity to provide manufacturers with thoughtful industrial solutions and a detailed knowledge of automation controls. Today the company proudly employs over 100 people, operating a 65,000 square foot facility in its Brighton, Michigan Headquarters and stocking offices in Cleveland, Ohio and Grand Rapids, Michigan.

Dedication to innovation and quality by both our valued customers and employees is the foundation on which Barnum is built, and has remained a driving force behind the company since its humble beginnings over six decades ago.

At Flag Lady Gifts, we offer much more than flags & banners! Please visit us often for an ever-changing selection of handbags, accessories, and seasonal treasures for the home, including brands like Bosom Buddy, Scout by Bungalow, Byers' Choice , Nora Fleming, Julia Knight, and Luminara flameless candles. We also carry a beautiful selection of sterling silver jewelry and fashion jewelry, including Lori Bonn, Chamilia, Kameleon, Nomination, Brighton, and Kiel James Patrick. We offer in-store engraving on all of our engraveable items. We have so many wonderful items in our store that we couldn't possibly post them all on this site! Our friendly staff is always ready to help you find the right gift for any occasion, plus, we are happy to gift-wrap and ship for you.

Founded in 1992, Flag Lady Gifts is located on the “Main Line” between Philadelphia and historic Valley Forge. The owner, Jan Hartman, began by designing and sewing decorative banners on her dining room table, which she originally sold at local holiday fairs. In 1993 she opened a charming shop in Spread Eagle Village, selling both flags and gifts. One expansion and several years later, we had outgrown the location. In 2001, we moved across the street to our current airy two-level store on the corner of Lancaster Avenue and Conestoga Road, right across from the Strafford Farmers’ Market.

values: Bosom Buddy cuffs & Ata grass handbags

values.name: Flag Lady Gifts
